message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.FL, cs.SC. 

The paper discusses techniques and tools for verification of properties expressed as Horn clauses with constraints over a background theory (CHC), which is a topic related to logic programming and software engineering. Therefore, cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science) and cs.PL (Programming Languages) are the most likely sub-categories. The paper also mentions the use of abstract interpretation, program specialisation, and query-answer transformations, which are techniques commonly used in formal methods and software verification, suggesting that cs.SE (Software Engineering) and cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the design of automatic CHC verification tools, which could fall under cs.SC (Symbolic Computation).
